attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Billing in Bolt refers to the system's management of financial transactions through an internal Wallet system that supports two enterprise billing models: Centralized and Decentralized. This system controls how funds are allocated and spent across parent organizations and their branches.

## Key Details
- The Centralized Billing Model treats the Parent Organization as the "Bank," allowing all Child Branches to share a single pool of funds. Transactions can proceed even if a Child Branch has no individual budget, as long as the Parent Wallet has a balance [1].
- The Decentralized Billing Model requires each branch to maintain its own funds independently. Transactions fail if a branch has zero local balance, requiring recharging before proceeding [1][4].
- The system automatically identifies the wallet type during transactions, ensuring correct billing behavior such as deducting from the Parent Wallet in centralized mode or blocking transactions in decentralized mode when funds are insufficient [4].

## References
[1] Billing & Enterprise Wallet Logic — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/billing-and-enterprise-wallet-logic  
[4] Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors"}
